data.title: Food
data.text: Had been dining there for years.  Always got the Chicken & Shrimp Hunan style.  Most of the time would get take out.  One evening while eating I discovered a half of a worm on my plate.  Will never go back there.  Should have reported it to the health department but did not.

data.title: If you eat for the TASTE-Go Here
data.text:
This place is in an older building and the decor is worn out but if you are going for the food as well as a great value, then this is the place to go in Longview. I like to order off the menu instead of doing the buffet. The menu is extensive and the portions are huge...most would feed two people. The flavors are just better than what you get at the other buffets or at Panda Express. 

Also, if you believe in supporting the disappearing family owned business...go here and give these guys your support. The food will NOT disappoint you!

data.title: Not your typical Chinese Buffet Fair
data.text: This buffet was very very good. Lots of house specialties like chip pork, garlic chicken. Jalapeño prawns. Variety of soups and appetizers. Only complaint is lack of service, but I'm guessing that's how they keep prices so low.

data.title: " The best of the rest"
data.text: For years Hunan's continues to offer fresh, excellent food in a buffet. There are many to choose from locally but in my opinion Hunan's is always the best and by a consistently large margin.

data.title: Very tasty buffet, good value, nice owners.
data.text: We found this little restaurant by accident, what a pleasant surprise. The food was very varied and flavourful.

data.title: Average
data.text: Have been to this restaurant several times. Not much to say. Just average. No real problems except that sometimes they have a problem keeping the food hot. Staff sometimes acts like there doing you a favor being there. But all in all, the food is good. We'll continue to go once in a while.

data.title: Great chinese ESPECIALLY for Longview or Texas
data.text:
The owner gives a free lemonade or ice tea to everybody!!
We come to Longview regularly on business and have tried many of the fare, and if we want Chinese this is where we go.

The beef in mushroom is superb, the sauce is light and does not overpower the umami of the mushrooms.

Pork fried rice has nice dragon's breath(smoke from the wok).

The pork lo-mein is VERY good not too many vegetables and they are cooked very well, the pork tastes through the noodles.

These are the three dishes we stick to after sampling the menu, but we usually add a 4th for variety and fried potstickers.

data.title: A top notch Chinese food buffet
data.text: I have grown tired of Chinese buffets over the years, but this one is an exception.  The food is fresh and interesting.  They don't go overboard with the selections and what they do offer is well prepared.  Service is good.
